title: 111_hr4000
content:
The Secretary of Education is authorized to provide grants to local educational agencies for conflict resolution and mediation programs in schools affected by violence. A model project must be developed within 90 days, with $25,000,000 authorized for fiscal year 2010. Grants will be used for programs benefiting students, teachers, and school personnel. Eligible applicants can request information on the conflict resolution model. To be eligible for a grant under this Act, a local educational agency must submit an application to the Secretary with specific information. The application must include a request for funds, details about the schools and communities to be served, statistical information on conflict and violence, and assurances that federal funds will supplement non-federal funds. Each application for a grant under this Act must include a comprehensive plan addressing conflict and violence issues in schools and the surrounding community. The plan should outline available resources, areas needing additional support, and a system to prevent and reduce ongoing problems. SEC. 6. ALLOCATION OF FUNDS; LIMITATIONS ON GRANTS. The Secretary can use up to 5% of funds for administration. Grants can be renewed for up to 2 years if funds were used as required and additional grant is needed for violence prevention program. SEC. 7. AWARD OF GRANTS. SEC. 7. AWARD OF GRANTS. The Secretary considers violence problem, need, and population when awarding grants to local educational agencies. Geographic distribution of grant awards is aimed to be equitable. SEC. 8. REPORTS.

Local educational agencies receiving funds must submit a detailed progress report by March 1 each year. The Secretary must also provide a report to Congress by October 1 detailing grant awards, recipient activities, statistical information, and program evaluations.

SEC. 9. DEFINITIONS. SEC. 9. DEFINITIONS. The term "local educational agency" is defined as in the Elementary and Secondary Education Act of 1965. The term "Secretary" refers to the Secretary of Education.
